CALENDAR OF TOPICS

11/11. Buddhism Is Not What You ?Think.? Discover how to live compassionately and wise in tune Reality. From the book by Steve Hagen. Presented by Linda Clark

11/18. The Daily Practice of Thanksgiving. Explore living in gratitude as an expression of daily practice. Includes Touching of Earth Ceremony.

11/25. The (Com)passion of Buddha. A look into compassion in Shin Buddhist and how to experience and practice it in our daily lives. by Jeff Zyjeski

12/2. Right Speech, Right Living. A look into our assumptions & how to let go & be mindful with our speech. from the book The Four Agreements, by Don Miguel Ruiz., presented by Juliane Dean.



Meet and practice with other local Buddhists and those interested in Buddhism. On average, between 30 - 40 people attend weekly. Most do not come through this "meet up" venue but through its web site, outreach and word of mouth.

visit our main web site at
www.bffct.net

We practice quiet sitting meditation, sacred chants, and mindfulness. Includes lively discussions on the practical daily application of Buddhism. Open to all seekers of wisdom and compassion from beginners to the most advanced.

We meet on most Sunday mornings from 10 - 12:15 p.m. at the Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Connecticut. Google us, "Buddhist Faith Fellowship" for schedule, philosophy and directions.

Our group was established in 2001 with a Mahayana orientation, focusing on Shin Buddhism.

We have two local Affiliated Chapters:

SOUTHINGTON BUDDHIST FELLOWSHIP

http://southington.bf...

BUDDHA GAIA

http://buddhagaia.bff...


"Consider others as yourself"
-- the Buddha
